result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Richard Cunningham

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

*NOT ON RECORD* Defendant Joshua Richard Cunningham appeared by phone.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by phone for Joshua Richard Cunningham.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Discovery received. Offer received. Attorney Cupino request plea/sentencing hearing

9:37 AM Defendant Joshua Richard Cunningham appeared by phone.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by phone for Joshua Richard Cunningham.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense motion to modify bond as to conditions, to allow contact with wife and children.
Court notes Day Reporting compliance.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
Atty Cupino - requesting no contact order to be lifted with wife and children. Notes that charges do not involve violence against his family and notes pending cases involving children.
State objects to any bond modification and notes that wife has picked up her own case regarding these charges and has a no contact condition w/Deft on her bond. State looking into Bail Jumping charges against Deft at this time. Has also reached out to SW regarding children and cannot determine level of safety.
Court will not change no contact order conditions at this time.
Bail/bond hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Richard Cunningham appeared by phone.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by phone for Joshua Richard Cunningham. 
Court received and reviewed motion to modify bond based on day reporting performance.
State requests the Court increase cash bond. 
950 complied with. 
Defense requests that the bond remain the same.
Court warns the deft and expects full compliance with bond conditions going forward.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their 
Not possess any dangerous weapons. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. .
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements  - UA's

11:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Richard Cunningham appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ali M Mahmood appeared by video for Joshua Richard Cunningham. Defendant advised of rights. Received complaint/waived reading. NG Plea entered. Probable cause found in the complaint. Bond set.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
